case_vignette: A 54-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife because of progressive difficulty walking during the past 3 months. He has not been able to walk without assistance for the past month and has started to use a wheelchair. He also reports having urinary incontinence for 1 year. His wife says that he has begun to slur his words and has become very difficult to understand. His temperature is 37.0°C (98.6°F), pulse is 70/min, and respirations are 16/min. His blood pressure is 130/80mm Hg while sitting and 110/65mm Hg when standing. He is oriented to person and place but not to time. Neurological examination shows a mild tremor in his right hand and rigidity in his upper and lower extremities. He is unable to perform repetitive rotary forearm movements.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having progressive difficulty walking for the past 3 months and now I can't walk without help, so I've started using a wheelchair.
Thank you for sharing that information. Can you tell me, have you experienced any weakness or numbness in your legs or feet?
No, but my walking has gotten worse over time.
Okay, that's helpful to know. Have you noticed any changes in your balance or coordination?
Yes, my balance has been off, which is part of why I need help walking.
Great, that helps to narrow it down. Have you experienced any sudden or severe headaches, dizziness, or loss of vision?
No, I haven't had any headaches, dizziness, or loss of vision.
Okay, that's good to know. Have you noticed any tremors or difficulty with speech?
Yes, my hand has a mild tremor, and my speech has become slurred and hard to understand.

Thank you for sharing that information. Based on what you've told me, I would like to perform a few simple tests to help determine the cause of your symptoms. Can you please stand up and walk to the end of the room and back to me? And can you please repeat the sentence "The cat sat on the mat" for me?

I can't walk without assistance anymore, so I won't be able to walk to the end of the room without help. And for the sentence, when I try to say "The cat sat on the mat," my words come out slurred and are very difficult to understand.

Okay, no problem. Based on what you've told me, I would like to perform a series of tests to assess your cognitive and motor functions. Can you please follow my instructions as closely as possible?

First, I would like you to repeat the sentence "The cat sat on the mat" for me again, as you mentioned it's difficult for you to speak clearly. After that, I would like you to listen to a series of words and repeat them back to me as closely as possible. Finally, I would like you to perform a simple math calculation in your head and tell me the result.

Can you do that for me?
I can try, but my speech is really slurred, so it's hard to understand what I'm saying.

Of course, I understand. Please try your best to repeat the sentence "The cat sat on the mat" for me. I will do my best to understand you.

Also, I would like you to listen to the following words and repeat them back to me: "apple", "dog", "house", and "car". Can you do that for me?
"The cat sat on the mat"... (slurred speech). Apple, dog, house, car... (attempting to repeat with difficulty)

Thank you for trying your best to repeat the words. Based on your responses, I would like to perform some additional tests to help determine the cause of your slurred speech and difficulty walking.

Can you please follow my instructions and try to stand up from the chair and walk to the door? I will be observing your movements and assessing your balance and coordination.

Also, I would like you to repeat the sentence "The cat sat on the mat" one more time for me, and this time I would like you to speak as clearly as possible. Can you do that for me?
I can't stand up or walk on my own since I've been using a wheelchair, and when I say "The cat sat on the mat" again, my speech will still be slurred.

Thank you for letting me know. Based on your responses, it seems that you may be experiencing some cognitive and motor impairments. I would like to refer you to a neurologist for further evaluation and assessment. They will be able to perform more detailed tests to determine the cause of your symptoms and recommend appropriate treatment options.

In the meantime, I would recommend that you avoid any strenuous activities and take regular breaks to rest and recharge. It's also important to stay hydrated and eat a healthy diet to help maintain your overall health and well-being.

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns, or if there's anything else I can do to help.
